intro: Capanea oerstedii, commonly known as the Oersted's capanea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, specifically found in Jamaica. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
